H0.text: Orbiting the Earth is what the Earth's gravitational force causes the moon to do.

H1.text: Overlap the earth is what Earth's gravitational force causes the moon to do.

H2.text: Change size is what the Earth's gravitational force causes the Moon to do.

H3.text: Lose orbit is what the Earth's gravitational force causes the moon to do.

A4.text: The Moon orbits Earth in the prograde direction and completes one revolution relative to the Vernal Equinox and the fixed stars in about 27.3 days (a tropical month and a sidereal month), and one revolution relative to the Sun in about 29.5 days (a synodic month).
